WBlake invBlake's signature
appears in the lower right corner.

illustration.illusobjdesc:
A gowned female representing Melancholy stands in the center of the
design. She wears a semi-transparent veil, scarf, or hood over her head. The figure's arms
are down at her sides with the palms turned down. Two gowned females representing
Peace and Quiet stand to the left of Melancholy. The figure to the left has long
hair and a spiky halo radiates from her head. Her right arm is bent upwards and
she holds a shepherd's crook with her right hand. The figure to the right faces
forward with her head turned to the left. Her hair is drawn back in a bun and a
halo of light surrounds her head. Her arms are bent with her hands held together
and the palms vertical; she may be praying. A gowned male representing Fast stands
to the right of Melancholy. Fast's arms are bent upward and cross at the wrists;
his hands rest on his chest with the fingers spread. He faces to the left with his
head bent back; he likely looks at the figures above. At least six gowned figures
stand on a cloud above the personification of Fast. They probably represent the
Muses. A fire burns on an altar in the center of the group. A gowned male
representing Leisure stands in a garden to the right of Fast; an aura of light
surrounds his body. Leisure's arms are crossed in front of his chest. Two tall,
vine-like plants appear to the left and right of Leisure; both have several leaves
and large flowers or fruit. A forest of leafy trees appears left and right of the
central figure; four tree trunks are visible. The ground below is covered with
grass. A gowned male angel representing the cherub Contemplation kneels on a fiery
plinth of two steps (described as a throne in the poem) above the central figure. The figure has large, outstretched wings. His
arms are raised horizontally with the palms turned up. His right knee is drawn up
and his right foot is visible below the hem of his garment. A gowned female(?)
representing Night rests on a cloud to the left of Melancholy. The figure lies in
a contracted position with her knees drawn up and her body twisted to the right.
Her legs are crossed at the ankles. Night's arms are bent and wrap around her
head. Her head is turned down and she looks at the nude figure below. A nude
female representing Philomel hovers below Night. The figure is seen from
behind. Her right leg is bent with the sole of her right foot turned out towards
the viewer. Philomel's arms are raised vertically and her head is turned up; she
may be reaching toward Night. A gowned female representing the goddess Cynthia
kneels on a crescent moon to the right of Melancholy. The figure is seen from
beind and faces to the right. Cynthia's left arm appears to be braced against the
crescent moon; her right arm is bent forward with her wrist resting on the tip of
the moon. The moon is drawn by two bat-winged dragons to the right. The dragons' heads
are topped by spiky crests and their tails extend above and to the left of the
moon. The dragons' mouths are open; the upper dragon holds its head up with the
tongue extended. Cynthia holds the dragons' reins in her right hand. A cloud
extends to the left and right of the moon. The night sky contains six stars.

component.illusobjdesc:
A gowned female representing the personification of Melancholy
stands in the center of the design, facing forward. Her eyes are raised and she
may look at the winged figure above. A halo of light surrounds her head. Her
left foot is visible below the hem of her garment. She wears a semi-transparent
veil, scarf, or hood over her head. Traces of her long hair are visible over both
shoulders and below her hands. The figure's arms are down at her sides with the
palms turned down, fingers slightly spread.

Two gowned females stand to the left of Melancholy; they likely
represent personifications of Peace and Quiet. The figure to the left faces
left with her head turned to the right. She has long hair and a spiky halo
radiates from her head. Her left arm is bent across her body. Her right arm is
bent upwards and she holds a shepherd's crook with her right hand. The fingers
on both hands are spread.

Two gowned females stand to the left of Melancholy; they likely
represent personifications of Peace and Quiet. The figure to the right faces
forward with her head turned to the left. Her hair is drawn back in a bun and a
halo of light surrounds her head. Her left foot is visible below the hem of her
garment. The figure's arms are bent with her hands held together and the palms
vertical; she may be praying.

A gowned male stands to the right of Melancholy; he likely
represents the personification of Fast (that is, fasting). His feet are both visible below the hem
of his garment; his right foot is raised on tiptoe. The figure's arms are bent
upward and cross at the wrists; his hands rest on his chest with the fingers
spread. He faces to the left with his head bent back; he likely looks at the
Muses above. The figure has short hair.

At least six gowned figures stand on a cloud above the
personification of Fast; they likely represent the female Muses. The first and
second figures from the left may be seen from behind and face away from the
viewer; the figure furthest left appears to raise her arms at 135 degrees. The
figure third from the left faces left with her left arm at her side. The figure
fourth from the left faces left; her left arm appears to be bent. The fifth and
sixth figures from the left are indistinct.

The Muses stand on a narrow cloud. A fire burns on an altar in the
center of the group.

A gowned male stands in a garden to the right of Fast; he likely
represents the personification of Leisure. He faces forward and to the right with his eyes
raised. An aura of light surrounds his body. Both feet are visible below the
hem of his garment; his right foot is raised on tiptoe. The figure's arms are
crossed in front of his chest.

Two tall, vine-like plants appear to the left and right of Leisure.
The plant to the left has at least four leaves or flowers; the plant to the
right has six leaves and perhaps nine flowers or fruits.

A forest of leafy trees appears left and right of the central
figure; four tree trunks are visible. The ground below is covered with
grass.

A gowned male angel kneels on a fiery throne above the central
figure; he represents the cherub Contemplation. The figure has large,
outstretched wings. His head is held up and his long, flame-like hair stands on end, right and left of his head. His
eyes are raised and his mouth may be open. Contemplation's arms are raised
horizontally with the palms turned up and the fingers slightly spread. His
right knee is drawn up and his right foot is visible below the hem of his
garment.

The figure of Contemplation kneels on a plinth of two steps with two
fiery wheels; it is described as a throne in Milton's poem.

A gowned female with long hair rests on a cloud to the left of
Melancholy; she likely represents the personification of Night. The figure lies
in a contracted position with her knees drawn up and her body twisted to the
right. Her knees are prominent and her legs are crossed at the ankles. Her head is turned down and she
looks at the nude figure below. The figure's arms are bent and wrap around her
head.

A nude female hovers below the personification of Night; she
likely represents Philomel. The figure is seen from behind. Her right leg is
bent with the sole of her right foot turned out towards the viewer. Her arms
are raised vertically and her head is turned up; she may be reaching toward
Night.

A gowned female representing the goddess Cynthia kneels on a
crescent moon to the right of Melancholy. The figure is seen from beind and
faces to the right. Her hair may be drawn back in a bun. Her right leg is bent
beneath her body with the right foot visible. The figure's left arm appears to
be braced against the moon. Her right arm is bent forward with her wrist
resting on the tip of the moon; she holds a set of reins in her right
hand.

Cynthia kneels on a crescent moon to the right of Melancholy. The
moon is drawn like a chariot by two bat-winged dragons to the right. The dragons' heads are topped
by spiky crests. Their tails extend above and to the left of the moon. Both
dragons' mouths are open; the upper dragon holds its head up with the tongue
extended. Cynthia holds the dragons' reins in her right hand.

The night sky contains six stars. The personification of Night (left of the large central figure) rests
on a cloud which extends above her to the left. Another cloud appears to the
left and right of the crescent moon, extending upward and to the
right.

lg.l:
W Blake invBlake's signature appears in
the lower left corner.

illustration.illusobjdesc:
Milton stands in the lower right corner of the design facing left; he
is seen from behind. He has long hair and wears a student's cap and gown. Milton
also wears shoes; his left foot is raised on tiptoe. His left arm is bent with
the palm turned out and away from the viewer. His head is slightly turned up with
his eyes raised; he looks toward the figure above. The female personification of
the Moon stands on a cloud above and to the left of Milton. She is partly nude and
wears a semi-transparent gown with her breasts exposed; she also wears armor that
covers her shins and feet. Her legs are spread apart with the left leg slightly
bent; both feet appear to be raised on tiptoe. She may stride or walk to the
right. Both arms are bent; her right arm is bent upward. The figure's
right palm is held vertically and the left is turned out away from the viewer; the
fingers on both hands are spread. She faces forward with her head turned to the
left; her eyes are raised and her expression suggests fear or apprehension. A crescent moon (but with its full circular form still visible)
appears above and to the right of the female Moon. It is surrounded by a halo;
beams of light radiate outward from the halo. The scene takes place at night. A
continuous band of clouds forms a horseshoe around the personification of the
Moon. A total of fourteen stars appear in the sky attached to vine-like
structures. A body of water extends horizontally across the lower half of the
design. It may be a lake, river, or the sea. Small waves are visible throughout.
The ground below Milton is covered with grass. Four flowers or buds appear in the
lower left corner of the design. Above the water, leafy vegetation may suggest a
dense forest of trees. A church is visible within the leafy forest, directly below
the female Moon. It has a tall spire or steeple and a single arched window or door.

component.illusobjdesc:
Milton stands in the lower right corner of the design facing left;
he is seen from behind. He has long hair and wears a student's cap and gown.
Milton also wears shoes; his left foot is raised on tiptoe. His left arm is
bent with the palm turned out and away from the viewer; the position of his
right arm is not clear. His head is slightly turned up with his eyes raised; he
looks toward the figure above.

The female personification of the Moon stands on a cloud above and
to the left of Milton. She is partly nude and wears a semi-transparent gown
with her breasts exposed. She also wears armor that covers her shins and feet.
Her legs are spread apart with the left leg slightly bent; both feet appear to
be raised on tiptoe. She may stride or walk to the right. Both arms are bent;
her left arm is held nearly horizontally and her right arm is bent upward. The figure's right palm is held
vertically and the left is turned out away from the viewer; the fingers on both
hands are spread. She faces forward with her head turned to the left; her eyes
are raised and her expression suggests fear or apprehension. Her hair is long.

A crescent moon (but with its full circular form visible) appears above and to the right of the female Moon.
It is surrounded by a halo; beams of light radiate outward from the
halo.

The scene takes place at night. A continuous band of clouds forms a
horseshoe around the personification of the Moon. A total of fourteen stars
appear in the sky and are attached to vine-like structures. A group of seven
stars appears to the left of the female Moon; a group of five appears to the
right. A single star appears below the Moon, and a final star is visible below
and to the left.

A body of water extends horizontally across the lower half of the
design. It may be a lake, river, or the sea. Small waves are visible
throughout.

The ground below Milton is covered with grass. Four flowers or buds, apparently growing on a plant,
appear in the lower left corner of the design. Above the water on the distant shore, leafy
vegetation may suggest a dense forest of trees.

A church is visible within the leafy forest, directly below the
female Moon. It has a tall spire or steeple and a single arched
window or door.

lg.l:
W Blake invBlake's signature appears in
the lower left corner.

illustration.illusobjdesc:
Milton sits on a chair in the lower half of the design, facing
left. His left arm is bent and rests in his lap with his left hand on his knee.
His right arm is bent upward with the elbow resting on an open book; he holds his
forehead with his right hand. Milton's eyes are cast down and he may be reading.
The spirit of Plato stands or hovers to the left of Milton. He faces forward with
his head turned slightly down and to the right; his eyes are cast down and he
looks at Milton. Plato's left arm is down at his side. His right arm is bent
upward with the palm held vertically and the fingers spread; he may point upwards.
Three figures lay supine below and to the left of Plato; only their heads and
shoulders are visible. The two upper figures have beards. The three figures' eyes
are closed and they may be dead. Three figures representing fire spirits appear in
a column of fire to the left of Plato. Two nude females stand or hover within the
fire. The figure furthest left raises her arms above her head, while the figure to
the right holds her hands beside her head. Both look up towards a third spirit;
this figure raises his or her arms vertically and may be falling. Six figures
representing the spirits of earth lay on the ground below Milton. The figures are
surrounded by large leaves, and the ground may be covered with grass. The spirit
furthest left rests its head on its right hand; only its upper body is visible,
and it may be partially buried in the earth. To the right, a child or infant is
held by a nude female; the child's right arm and leg appear to be wrapped in
vines. To the right, a nude female lays horizontally with her arms raised at 135
degrees. The figure is vegetating; her right arm grows into a branch with three
flowers and the toes on her left foot terminate in vines or roots. A branch with a
single flower extends from the top of her head to the right. To the right, two
nude figures lay on their sides and appear to be partially buried in the earth.
The figure furthest right is seen from behind. Two figures representing water spirits appear to the right of Milton. The
uppermost figure is a nude female with fins that look like bat wings; she may be hovering or
swimming. The spirit holds an object in her right hand; it may be a shuttle or the end of a large
net that appears below the figure. The lower figure falls or hovers upside down,
and may be caught in the net. Five figures representing the spirits of air fly or
hover above Milton's head. The group forms a circle or halo of light. The Great
Bear constellation appears to the right of Milton. The bear stands facing right in
profile. Seven stars form the constellation within and to the left of the bear's
body. Hermes flies or hovers above and to the right of Milton. He is seen from
behind with his head turned to the left. He wears a gown or cloak and a winged
helmet. The figure's arms are down at his side and he may point downward with his
left hand. His right hand is obscured, but he likely holds a scepter that appears
to the right of his lower body. Three circles appear in the upper portion of the
design; the images within these circles represent Plato's Heavens. Coloring within
each circle suggests fire and possibly smoke. The central circle is partially
obscured by the other two. A nude female representing Venus stands in the circle
furthest left. She faces forward with her torso twisted and bent slightly to the
right. Her right arm is wrapped around her waist; her left arm is extended. Two nude figures stand back-to-back to the left of Venus. They are bound
together by a vine that crosses at their ankles and hips, and rises above their
heads. Alternatively, they are bound with a heavy rope and the vegetation above them is a separate motif. A nude(?) figure stands within the leftmost circle to the right of Plato.
The figure's left arm is raised horizontally and touches the shoulder or back of
the figure to the right. To the right, a nude female(?) stands facing right in
profile. Her head is down and apparently rests on her right hand in a posture
suggesting grief or despair. A male figure representing Mars appears in the
central circle. He wears a gown or other clothing and a hat or helmet. He holds a
spear in his left hand. His knees are drawn up in front of his chest. A bat flies
on outstretched wings to the left of Mars. A gowned male representing Jupiter
appears in the rightmost circle. He sits on a series of platforms possibly
representing a throne, altar, or stairs. He has long hair and a beard and may wear
a crown of laurels. He holds a scepter spear in his left hand and a set of compasses or dividers in
his right. A nude male(?) appears to the left of Jupiter. He is seen from behind
and climbs a set of stairs or steps. His right arm is bent and drawn back; his
left arm is not clearly pictured, but may reach forward and to the right. He holds
or touches a large circular object, possibly a shield. Three nude females
representing the Fates sit or kneel above the circles of Plato's Heavens. The
figure furthest left is Atropos. she is seen from behind with her head turned to the right. She
holds the thread of life in her left hand and an open pair of scissors in her
right. Her companion to the right, Lachesis, holds the thread of life in both hands. Her head
is turned up and her mouth is open. The figure furthest right, Clotho, holds a distaff in
her left hand.

component.illusobjdesc:
Milton sits on a chair or bench in the lower half of the design,
facing left. He has long hair and wears a gown and shoes; only his left foot is
visible below the hem of his garment. Milton's left arm is bent and rests in
his lap with his left hand on his knee. His right arm is bent upward with the
elbow resting on an open book; he holds his forehead with his right hand.
Milton's eyes are cast down and he may be reading.

Milton sits on a cushioned chair in the lower half of the
design. To the left, an open book rests on a table.

The spirit of Plato stands or hovers to the left of Milton. He has
long hair and a beard and wears a gown. Plato faces forward with his head
turned slightly down and to the right; his eyes are cast down and he looks at
Milton. Plato's left arm is down at his side. His right arm is bent upward with
the palm held vertically and the fingers spread; he may point
upwards.

The spirit of Plato may stand on a cloud which rises vertically to
the left and right of his body.

Three figures lay supine below and to the left of Plato; only their
heads and shoulders are visible. The two upper figures have beards. All three
figures' eyes are closed and they may be dead.

Three figures appear in a column of fire to the left of Plato. Dark
edges may indicate shadows or smoke.

Three fire spirits appear in a column of flames to the left of
Plato. A nude female with prominent breasts stands or hovers furthest left. Her body faces forward and
bends slightly to the left; her head is turned up and she looks at the spirit
above. The figure's mouth is open. Traces of long hair appear above her left
shoulder. Her left leg is slightly bent and both feet may be raised on tiptoe.
The spirit's left arm is raised at 135 degrees and her right is bent upward
above her head; both palms appear to face up and out towards the
viewer.

Three fire spirits appear in a column of flames to the left of
Plato. A nude female stands or hovers furthest right. Her body faces forward
with her head turned up and to the left; she likely looks at the spirit above.
Both legs are bent to the left. The figure's arms are bent upward to either
side of her head; both palms are turned out toward the viewer.

Three fire spirits appear in a column of flames to the left of
Plato. A nude spirit of indeterminate gender hovers above the other two
figures. He or she may be falling. The figure faces down and slightly left with
his or her head turned down; the spirit may look at the figures below. His or
her legs are bent and spread apart. The figure's arms are raised vertically.
Lines on the figure's forehead may indicate short hair.

Six figures representing the spirits of earth lay on the ground
below Milton. The figures are surrounded by large leaves, and the ground may be
covered with grass.

Six figures representing the spirits of earth appear below Milton.
Furthest left, the upper body of a nude figure leans against a large leaf. The
figure may be partially buried in the earth. His or her right arm is bent
upward with the elbow resting on the ground. The figure's head is turned
slightly up and to the right and rests on his or her right hand.

Six figures representing the spirits of earth appear below Milton. A
nude infant or child of indeterminate gender sits or reclines second from the left. He or
she is held by the female to the right. The child has short, possibly curly
hair. The figure faces forward with its head resting on its left shoulder; the
child is smiling and looks out toward the viewer. The child's right leg extends
to the right. The right arm is raised at 135 degrees and the child holds a
spiky flower or other vegetation in its right hand. There are indications of a
vine wrapped around the child's right arm and right leg.

Six figures representing the spirits of earth appear below Milton. A
nude female kneels or crouches third from the left. She may be partially buried
in the earth. She faces left in profile with her body bent and her head down.
The figure's left arm is bent and she holds or embraces the child to the left.
Her hair may be drawn back in a bun.

Six figures representing the spirits of earth appear below Milton. A
nude female lays on the ground fourth from the left. The figure's body lays
horizontally with her head to the right. Her lower body faces forward with her
upper body twisted to face up. Her arms are raised at 135 degrees relative to
her body; her left palm may be turned up. The figure is vegetating; her right
arm grows into a branch with three flowers and the toes on her left foot
terminate in vines or roots. A branch with a single flower extends from the top
of her head to the right.

Six figures representing the spirits of earth appear below Milton. A
nude(?) female lays on the ground fifth from the left. Only her upper body is
visible; she may be partially buried in the earth. Her body is horizontal with
her head raised and turned to the right. Her hair may be drawn back into a bun.
Her right arm may rest at her side.

Six figures representing the spirits of earth appear below Milton.
Furthest right, the upper body of a nude(?) figure lays on the ground. He or
she may be partially buried in the earth. The figure is seen from behind. Its
body is horizontal with the head down and to the right. The figure's head may
rest on its right shoulder.

The area to the right of Milton's chair appears to be filled with
water with several waves visible. A dark shadow extends outward from the lower
right. Two figures represent the spirits of water.

Two figures representing water spirits appear to the right of
Milton. The uppermost figure is a nude female with fins that look like bat wings; she may be
hovering or swimming. Her breasts are prominent. Her body faces forward with her head turned slightly down
and to the right; she likely looks at the figure below. The figure's hair is
standing on end, perhaps floating upward in the water. Her legs are bent and drawn up to the left. The figure's arms
are raised at 135 degrees. Her left palm is turned up and her right palm is
turned down. She holds an object in her right hand; it may be a shuttle or the end of a large
net that appears below the figure. If a shuttle, she may be weaving the net.

Two figures representing water spirits appear to the right of
Milton. The lower figure swims, falls, sinks, or hovers upside down, and may be caught in a
net. The figure may be drowning. The figure's left leg is bent and extends upward; the right leg is not
pictured. The figure's left arm is bent and wrapped under its head; the right
arm is extended down and to the right. Both arms are raised vertically relative to the figure's body.

Five figures representing the spirits of air appear above Milton's
head. The group forms a circle or halo of light.

Five figures representing the spirits of air appear above Milton's
head. A nude(?) female flies or hovers just above and to the left of Milton.
She faces left, possibly with her face turned downward. Her left leg is bent and
drawn up. Her left arm is raised horizontally and her right is bent upward over
her head. She may be holding two indeterminate cicrular objects or forming her hands into fists.

Five figures representing the spirits of air appear above Milton's
head. A gowned female(?) flies or hovers furthest left. The figure is seen from
behind and faces away with her head turned to the right. Her body twists or
arches to the right. Her left leg is extended backward and to the right; her
right leg is not distinctly pictured. The figure's arms are bent; her left arm
is bent upward above her head. Her left palm may be held
veritcally.

Five figures representing the spirits of air appear above Milton's
head. The uppermost figure appears to crawl to the right; it may be flying or
hovering. The figure's body is horizontal with the head possibly turned down.
The spirit's right leg is bent and the left leg appears to be extended backward
to the left. The right arm is down while the left is raised vertically with
respect to the figure's body.

Five figures representing the spirits of air appear above Milton's
head. A nude spirit hovers or flies upside down to the right of the crawling
figure; it may be falling. The figure is seen from behind. His or her legs are
together and arch up and to the left. The spirit's arms are raised at 135
degrees relative to its body.

Five figures representing the spirits of air appear above Milton's
head. A gowned(?) and twisted figure flies or hovers just to the right of Milton. The spirit
appears to face up and to the right with his or her arms raised vertically.

The Great Bear constellation appears to the right of Milton. The
bear stands facing right in profile. Seven stars form the constellation within
and to the left of the bear's body.

Hermes flies or hovers above and to the right of Milton. He is seen
from behind with his head turned to the left. He wears a gown or cloak and a
winged helmet. The figure's arms are down at his side. He may point downward
with his left hand. His right hand is obscured, but he likely holds a scepter
that appears to the right of his lower body.

Three circles or globes appear in the upper portion of the design; the images
within these circles represent Plato's Heavens. Coloring within each circle
suggests fire and possibly smoke. The central circle is partially obscured by
the other two. The area above the circles and along the upper right and left borders of the design are colored to suggest more fire.

A nude female representing Venus stands in the circle furthest left.
She faces forward with her torso twisted and bent slightly to the right. Her
head is bent back and may rest on her left shoulder; her eyes are raised and
she may look at the figure above. Her right arm is bent across her body. Her
left arm is raised at approximately 135 degrees; her left palm may be turned
down.

Two nude figures stand back-to-back to the left of Venus. They are
bound together by a vine that crosses at their ankles and hips, and rises above
their heads. Alternatively, they are bound with thick ropes and the vegetation above their heads is a separate motif. The right arm of the figure to the right is positioned behind his
or her back. The figure to the left faces left while the figure to the right
faces right.

A nude(?) figure stands within the leftmost circle to the right of
Plato. The figure's right leg is bent and may be raised on tiptoe. The figure's
left arm is raised horizontally and touches the figure to the right. The figure
appears to face left but may have his or her head turned to the
right.

A nude female(?) stands within the leftmost circle to the right of
Plato. She faces right in profile. Her left leg is bent with the left foot
raised on tiptoe. Her right arm is bent upward. Her head is down and apparently
rests on her right hand in a posture suggesting grief or
despair.

A male figure representing Mars appears in the center circle in the
upper portion of the design. The figure is partially obscured. He wears a gown, shirt,
or other clothing and a hat or helmet possibly decorated with feathers or plumes of some sort. His knees are drawn up in front of his
chest. The figure has long hair and may have a short beard. He holds a spear in
his left hand.

A bat with outstretched wings flies within the center circle to the
left of Mars.

A gowned male representing Jupiter sits in the rightmost circle in
the upper portion of the design. He has long hair and a beard. He may wear a
crown of laurels. He sits on a raised platform or plinth with his right leg bent (knee prominent) and his
left leg extended slightly to the right. Both arms are bent and rest at his
sides. He holds a spear or scepter in his left hand and a set of compasses or dividers in his
right.

Jupiter sits on a raised platform or plinth, possibly representing a throne,
altar, or a series of steps or stairs.

A nude male(?) appears to the left of Jupiter. He is seen from
behind and climbs a set of stairs or steps. His right leg is bent and drawn up
while his left is extended down; his left foot is raised on tiptoe. The figure
bends slightly to the right. His right arm is bent and drawn back; his left arm
is not clearly pictured, but may reach forward and to the right. He holds or
touches a large circular object, possibly a shield.

Three nude females representing the Fates sit or kneel above the
circles of Plato's Heavens. The figure furthest left is Atropos, who cuts the thread of life. She seen from behind. She
faces away with her head turned to the right. Her long hair partially stands on
end. Both legs are bent and spread apart; her left leg is bent behind her while
her right leg is bent to the right. Her left arm is raised at approximately 45
degrees and she holds the thread of life in her left hand. Her right arm is
bent upward and she holds a pair of open scissors in her right
hand to cut the thread.

Three nude females representing the Fates sit or kneel above the
circles of Plato's Heavens. The figure second from the left is Lachesis, who measures the length of the thread of life. She faces forward with
her head turned up. She has long hair and her mouth is open. She sits with her
right leg bent beneath her body and her left leg extended to the right. Her
right arm is raised at 45 degrees while her left is raised at 135 degrees; she
holds the thread of life with both hands.

Three nude females representing the Fates sit or kneel above the
circles of Plato's Heavens. The figure furthest right is Clotho, who spins the thread of life. She faces forward with her
head turned to the right. She has long hair and her mouth may be slightly open. She sits
with her right leg bent to the left and her left leg extended to the right. Her
left arm is raised at 135 degrees. Her right arm is raised horizontally, and
she holds a distaff in her right hand.

lg.l:
WBlake invBlake's signature
appears in the lower right corner. The lowers part of the letters have been
trimmed off the paper.

desc.objtitle: The Sun in His Wrath, Object 10 (Butlin 543.10)

illustration.illusobjdesc:
Milton stands in the lower right portion of the design, facing forward and left.
His right foot is raised on tiptoe and he may be walking to the left. Milton holds
a book in his left hand. He holds hands with the figure to the left. The female
personification of Melancholy leads Milton to the left. She is gowned and faces
forward with her head turned slightly to the right. A halo of light surrounds her
head. She has long hair and wears a long veil or other drapery over her
head. Both arms are down at her sides. Her right hand is held with the palm turned
down and the fingers slightly spread. The male personification of the Sun sits
atop the disc of the sun in the upper portion of the design. He is nude with his
genitals exposed. His legs are bent and spread apart, straddling the sun. His
right arm is bent upward above his head and his left arm is raised at 135 degrees;
he holds and throws darts with both hands. At least three darts appear between the
figure's hands, with additional darts and flaming sun beams appearing around the
figure; all are pointed down and to the left. Milton and Melancholy stand in a
forest of leafy trees; eight tree trunks are visible. Three tree spirits appear in
a tree to the left of Melancholy. The central figure of the group is a nude male
with long hair and a beard. He holds a scepter, possibly with an acorn finial, in his raised left hand.
Three additional tree spirits appear in a tree to the right of Milton. A snake or
serpent is coiled around the left arm of the uppermost spirit of the group. Two
personified insects fly to the left and right of the sun. The insect to the left
may be female; she faces forward and wears a spiky crown. The insect to the right
is seen from behind and has two antennae on its head. The ground below the figures
is covered with grass. A river or stream runs horizontally across the lower
portion of the design. A distant mountain rises above the treeline between Milton
and Melancholy. Wash surrounding the sun may suggest a sky at sunrise or sunset.

component.illusobjdesc:
Milton stands in the lower right portion of the design, facing forward and left.
His right foot is raised on tiptoe and he may be walking to the left. He has
long hair and wears a gown. Milton likely looks at the female figure to the
left. Both arms are down at his sides. He holds a book in his left hand and
holds hands with the figure to the left.

The female personification of Melancholy stands to the left of
Milton. She is gowned and faces forward with her head turned slightly to the
right. A halo of light surrounds her head. She has long hair and wears
a long veil or other drapery over her head. Both arms are down at her sides.
Her right hand is held with the palm turned down and the fingers slightly
spread. She holds Milton's right hand and leads him to the left.

The male personification of the Sun sits atop the disc of the sun in
the upper portion of the design. He is nude with his genitals exposed. His legs
are bent and spread apart, straddling the sun. He faces forward with his head
up and to the left. The figure's eyes are raised and his flame-like hair stands on end.
His right arm is bent upward above his head and his left arm is raised at 135
degrees; he holds and throws darts with both hands. At least three darts appear
between the figure's hands, with additional darts and flaming sun beams
appearing around the figure; all are pointed down and to the
left.
The personification of the sun sits astride the globe of the sun.

Milton and Melancholy stand in a forest of leafy trees; eight tree
trunks are visible. The ground below the figures is covered with
grass.

A distant river or stream runs horizontally across the lower portion
of the design.

A distant mountain rises above the treeline between Milton and
Melancholy.

Three tree spirits appear in the tree left of Melancholy. The
central figure is a nude, elderly male. He faces forward with his eyes raised; he may
look up and to the right towards the sun. He has long hair and a beard. His
legs ar drawn up with the knees prominent. The figure's right arm is bent
upward and he may point up with his right hand. His left arm is raised at 135
degrees; he holds a scepter, possibly with an acorn finial, in his left hand.

>Three tree spirits appear in the tree to the left of Melancholy.
The figure furthest left sits or crouches in a contracted position. The
figure's legs are drawn up to his or her chest with the knees prominent. The
figure's right arm is bent with the hand resting on the right knee; the
figure's head may rest on his or her right hand. The spirit's body faces
forward with the head turned to the right in profile.

Three tree spirits appear in the tree to the left of Melancholy. The
figure furthest right is gowned and seen from behind. The figure sits with the
left leg bent to the left; his or her right leg is not visible. The spirit's
torso is twisted to the right. His or her head is down. The figure's right arm
is bent upward with the palm held vertically.

A group of three tree spirits appears in the tree to the right of
Milton. The uppermost figure faces left with his or her head turned forward.
The spirit has curly hair. The figure's left knee appears to be drawn up. His
or her left arm is raised at 135 degrees and extends to the left. A snake or
serpent is coiled around the figure's left arm.

A snake or serpent appears coiled around a tree spirit's arm. The
snake faces left with its mouth open; its tongue may be extended. The snake has
a crest atop its head.

A group of three tree spirits appears in the tree to the right of
Milton. A gowned spirit hovers or flies just below the uppermost figure. The
spirit is seen from behind. The figure's arms are bent and his or her head is
down.

A group of three tree spirits appears in the tree to the right of
Milton. A gowned spirit hovers or flies just right of Milton's left arm. We probably see this figure from behind. The
figure's right arm is down at its side; the lef arm is not visible.

A female(?) personification of an insect flies on outstretched, spiky wings
to the left of the sun, facing forward. She is gowned and wears a spiky crown.
The figure's arms are raised at 135 degrees. Her legs may be together and
extend slightly to the left.

A personified insect flies on outstretched wings to the right of the
sun. The figure is seen from behind and faces away from the viewer. The insect
is gowned and a pair of antennae appears on his or her head. The figure's legs
are together and extend slightly to the right.

Wash surrounding the sun may suggest a sky at sunrise or
sunset.

lg.l:
WBlake invBlake's signature
appears in the lower left corner.

illustration.illusobjdesc:
Milton lies supine on the ground in the lower portion of the design. He sleeps
with his eyes closed and his head resting on a grassy mound or hillock. His body
is nearly horizontal with his legs extended down and to the right. Milton's arms
are at his sides with the his forearms resting on his lap; his arms are crossed at
the wrists with the palms turned down. Six spirits fly or hover immediately above
and below Milton; all six are nearly horizontal with their legs extended to the
right. Three of the six figures raise their arms horizontally; the figure
upper right bends its left arm and the upper central figure has its arms at its
sides. The figure lower right has its right arm bent upward. At least four of the figures hold and play instruments, including two
tambourines, a lyre, and a mandolin. A river or stream extends horizontally across
the lower portion of the design. The male(?) personification of Sleep appears
above and to the left of Milton; he may be flying or hovering, or possibly lays on or emerges from
a cloud. He is upside down and seen from behind with his head bent back and to the
right; he may look down at Milton. A halo of light surrounds his head. Two wings
extend at approximately 135 degrees relative to the figure's body. Three eyes
appear in the figure's left wing, which stretches horizontally above Milton, and four more are visible on the right wing. The
figure's right wing also contains a partially unrolled scroll and at least five
figures. A gowned female lies on the upper side of a scroll with her body partly
horizontal and her legs extended upward. Her arms are bent forward and rest on the
scroll. A couple—likely a male (left) and female (right)—appear
beneath one of the folds of the scroll. The figures embrace and share a kiss. Two
smaller, indistinct figures fly or hover to the left of the couple; the figure
furthest left appears to have its arms at its sides. Lines near the tip of the
right wing may suggest feathers, a net, or a web. There may be the face of a sixth figure in this area. Four concentric rings or circles
appear in the upper portion of the design; its coloring may suggest a rainbow.
Beams of light radiate outward from the center circle. Four spirits appear above
Milton within the circle of light. An old male figure with long hair and a beard sits
or kneels in the center of the circle, furthest left in the group. Both arms are bent; the
figure's left arm rests in his lap. A nude male with short hair flies or hovers
second from the left. He faces forward with his legs bent to the left. His head is
down and his shoulders prominent. The figure's arms are bent and wrap around his
head; he may clutch his head with his left hand. An old gowned male with long hair and
a beard flies or hovers third from the left. He faces forward with his legs
extended to the left. A halo of light surrounds his head. His arms are bent upward
in front of his chest with the palms turned out toward the viewer. The figure
furthest right sits in a contracted position with both legs drawn up. The figure's
head is down with both hands bent and wrapped around his head. His left elbow may
rest on a scroll. A scroll appears above Sleep's left wing. Another scroll extends
upward and to the left above the rainbow-like circle of light. Five small figures
appear near the scroll in the upper portion of the design. Furthest left, a figure
flies or hovers with its body nearly horizontal and its left leg bent to the
right. The figure's left arm is extended to the left; the figure may touch the
scroll. Above and to the right, a figure lays or reclines on the scroll. The
figure appears to face right. To the right, a gowned(?) figure kneels on the
scroll, facing left. To the right, a figure flies or hovers with its body
horizontal. Below and to the right, a nude figure is seen from behind with his or
her right arm raised at 135 degrees; he or she may touch the scroll. Leafy trees
appear in the upper corners of the design; the tree to the right has visible
branches that arch to the left. Wash in the upper portion of the design suggests
sky.

component.illusobjdesc:
Milton lies supine on the ground in the lower portion of the design. He is
gowned and has long hair. He sleeps with his eyes closed and his head resting
on a mound or hillock. His body is nearly horizontal with his legs extended
down and to the right. His legs are crossed at the ankles with the left foot
prominent. Milton's arms are at his sides with the his forearms resting on his
lap. His arms are crossed at the wrists with the palms turned
down.

Six spirits fly or hover immediately above and below Milton; all six
are nearly horizontal with their legs extended to the right. The figure in the
lower left is seen from behind and may be nude; the other figures are gowned.
Three of the six figures raise their arms horizontally; the figure in the upper
right bends its left arm upward and the upper central figure has its arms at its
sides. The figure lower right has its right arm bent upward. At least four of the figures hold and play instruments. The figures upper and lower left hold tambourines. The lower central figure holds a
lyre, and the figure in the upper right holds a mandolin. The figures, or at least the two lower center and left, may be female.

Milton rests on a grassy mound or hillock. Trees, with several trunks visible, are pictured above and to the right of Milton. Leafy trees appear in the
upper corners of the design; the tree to the right has visible branches that
arch to the left.

A river or stream extends horizontally across the lower portion of
the design.

The male(?) personification of Sleep appears above and to the left
of Milton; he may be flying or hovering, or possibly lying on or emerging from a cloud. He is
upside down and seen from behind with his head bent back and to the right; he
may look down at Milton. A halo of light surrounds his head. The figure's legs
are together with the soles of his feet turned out towards the viewer. Two
wings extend at approximately 135 degrees relative to the figure's body. Three
eyes appear in the figure's left wing and four more are visible on the right
wing. The figure's right wing also contains a partially unrolled scroll and at
least five figures. Lines near the tip of the right wing may suggest feathers,
a net, or a web.

At least five spirits appear within Sleep's right wing. A gowned female with
long hair lies on the upper side of a scroll with her body partly horizontal
and her legs extended upward. She faces to the right. Her arms are bent forward
and rest on the scroll. A couple—likely a male (left) and female
(right)—appear beneath one of the folds of the scroll. The figures
embrace and share a kiss. Two smaller, indistinct figures fly or hover to the
right of the couple. The figure furthest left appears to have its arms at its
sides. There may be the face of another figure right of the right end of the scroll, facing forward and perhaps with one arm wrapped below and on the right side of the head.

Four concentric rings or circles appear in the upper portion of the
design; their coloring suggests a rainbow. Beams of light radiate outward from
the center circle.

Four spirits appear above Milton within the circle of light. An elderly male
figure with long hair and a beard sits or kneels in the center of the circle,
furthest left. Both arms are bent and the figure's left arm rests in his
lap.

Four spirits appear above Milton within the circle of light. A nude
male with short hair flies or hovers in a contracted posture second from the left. He faces forward and down
with his legs bent to the left. His head is down and his shoulders prominent.
The figure's arms are bent and wrap around his head; he may clutch his head
with his left hand.

Four spirits appear above Milton within the of light. An elderly, gowned male
flies or hovers third from the left. He faces forward with his legs extended to
the left. The figure has long hair and a beard. A halo of light surrounds his
head. His arms are bent upward in front of his chest with the palms turned out
toward the viewer. His eyes may be raised.

A group of four spirits appear above Milton within a rainbow-like
circle of light. The figure furthest right sits in a contracted position with
both legs drawn up, knees prominent. The figure's head is down with both hands bent and wrapped
around his head. His left elbow may rest on a scroll.

A scroll appears above Sleep's left wing. Another scroll extends
upward and to the left above the circle of light.

Five small figures appear near the scroll in the upper portion of
the design. Furthest left, a figure flies or hovers with its body nearly
horizontal and its left leg bent to the right. The figure's left arm is
extended to the left; the figure may touch the scroll. Above and to the right,
a figure lays or reclines on the scroll. The figure appears to face right or forward. To
the right, a gowned(?) figure kneels on the scroll, facing left. The left arm of the kneeling figure is bent upward. To the right,
a figure flies or hovers with its body horizontal. Its left arm may be raised. Below and to the right, a
nude figure is seen from behind with his or her right arm raised at 135
degrees; he or she may touch the scroll.
Wash in the upper portion of the design suggests sky.

lg.l:
WBlake inv.Blake's signature appears in
the lower left corner.

desc.objtitle: Milton in His Old Age, Object 12 (Butlin 543.12)

illustration.illusobjdesc:
Milton sits in a dark cave or cell formed by the branches of two trees. The
trunks stand at the left and right borders of the design, with the branches
arching up towards the center; the branches are intertwined above Milton's head.
Milton wears a gown trimmed with fur or hair. His arms are raised horizontally
with the palms held vertically and the fingers spread. A halo of radiance emanates
from his head. Milton's eyes are raised and his is mouth open; he may look towards
the constellations above. An open book rests on a stone to the right of Milton;
coloring on the stone suggests moss. To the right, a candlestick rests on
another stone or ledge; a candle burns in the holder. The ground below Milton is
covered with grass. Other leafy vegetation appears to the left and right of a
partially buried figure lower left. Several flowering plants are visible to the left of
Milton; roses or other buds appear to the left and right of an embracing couple
and lilies grow further to the left. Two rosebuds appear below Milton. Two gowned
figures representing flower spirits stand to the left of Milton. The figure to the
right is likely female; her companion is of indeterminate gender. The figures are
embracing and share a kiss. Three gowned spirits hover or fly around the
embracing couple; two of the figures may hold and play pipes or trumpets, while the lowest (on the left) may hold and play a lyre. A gowned
female stands in the lower left corner of the design; she may represent a flower
spirit. She leans or arches to the left with her head turned to the right. Her
right arm is raised vertically with the palm held vertically. Her left arm is
raised at 45 degrees and she may hold or pull the partially buried figure to the
right. The buried spirit faces left in profile with his or her head turned
slightly up; the spirit's arms are raised at 135 degress and reach toward the
gowned female to the left. A nude female spirit lies on her side in the lower
right corner of the design; only her upper body is visible and she may be
partially buried in the earth. Her right arm is bent with her hand on her breast
and her fingers spread. She may be the mother of the two infants below. She may be offering her right breast to feed the infant on the left. The infant
futhest left is seen from behind and faces up; his or her left arm is raised
vertically and reaches toward the female spirit. The infant to the right faces
left in profile and suckles at the female's left breast. Four gowned female
spirits sit or kneel above and to the left of Milton. The figure furthest right
kneels in a contracted position bent to the right with her head down and her right
arm bent around her head. The three figures to the left raise their arms
vertically above their heads. There may be a fifth, indistinct figure further
left. Three gowned female spirits kneel on a cloud above and to the right of
Milton. Five constellations appear in the night sky; perhaps eighteen stars in all
are visible. The constellation furthest left represents Cancer. A nude figure with
short hair sits on a crab's back; the figure's legs are bent and spread apart. The
figure is seen from behind. His or her left arm may be bent upward; the right arm
is not pictured. The crab faces forward with two claws extended downward and at
least three legs visible. The constellation second from the left represents
Gemini; the twins Castor and Pollux hover with their legs extended slightly to the
right. Both figures are nude. The figure to the left faces forward with his right
arm raised at 135 degrees. The figure to the right is seen from behind and faces
away with his right arm raised horizontally; he may hold a shield. Each figure
holds his left arm at his side; they may touch or hold hands. The constellation
third from the left represents Orion. The figure is apparently nude, but clearly
wears a belt of three stars. He faces forward with his head turned slightly to the
right. Orion's left leg is bent and drawn up; his right leg is obscured. The
figure's arms are raised at 135 degrees; a cloth or other drapery appears over his
left arm and he holds a sword in his right hand. The constellation fourth from the
left represents Taurus. Only the head and front legs of the bull are pictured; the
bull's legs are bent as if it is running. The bull has two short horns, and its
eyes are pictured as stars. The constellation furthest right represents Aries; the
ram sits or lays facing right. A single curved horn is visible, and it may have a
tail. The body of the ram is obscured by a shepherd wearing a brimmed hat. The figure may be nude and seen
from behind; his or her body faces left with the head turned to the right. The
figure's left leg is bent and drawn up; the right leg is extended downward. The
shepherd's left arm is bent and the figure holds a shepherd's crook with his or
her left hand. The figure's right arm is raised at 45 degrees and may touch the
ram.

component.illusobjdesc:
Milton, now in age, sits in a cave in the lower portion of the design. His hair
is long. His eyes are raised and his mouth open; he may look towards the
constellations above. He wears a gown trimmed with fur or hair. Milton's left
foot is visible below the hem of his gown. His arms are raised horizontally
with the palms held vertically and the fingers spread. A halo of radiance with beams of light
emanates from his head.

Milton sits in a dark cave or cell formed by the branches of two trees. The
trunks stand at the left and right borders of the design, with the branches
arching towards the center; the branches are intertwined above Milton's
head. The roots of the tree lower left are visible.

An open book rests on a stone to the right of Milton; coloring on
the stone suggests moss. To the right, a candlestick with a curved handle rests on another stone
or ledge; a candle burns in the holder.

The ground below Milton is covered with grass. Other leafy
vegetation appears to the left and right of a partially buried figure. Several
flowering plants are visible to the left of Milton; roses or other buds appear
to the left and right of an embracing couple and lilies grow further to the
left. Two rosebuds appear below Milton.

Two gowned figures representing flower spirits stand to the left of
Milton. The figure to the right is likely female; her companion is of
indeterminate gender. The figures face each other and stand with their bodies
twisted or intertwined around each other; the figure closest to the viewer is partially seen
from behind with its torso turned to the right. Both figures appear to stand on
tiptoe; the figure furthest from the viewer may cross her left leg in front of
her right. The figures' arms are bent and wrap around each other's shoulders;
each figure rests one hand in the other's hair. The figures are embracing and
share a kiss.

Three gowned spirits hover or fly around the embracing couple. The
figure second from the left is seen from behind. The second and third figures
from the left may hold and play pipes or small musical horns. Their arms are bent to hold the instruments. The lowest figure, on the left, may hold and play a lyre.

A gowned female stands or hovers in the lower left corner of the design; she
may represent a flower spirit. She leans or arches to the left with her head
turned to the right. Her right arm is raised vertically with the palm held
vertically. Her left arm is raised at 45 degrees and she may hold or pull the
partially buried figure to the right. She is probably looking down at the partly buried figure.

The head and arms of a partially buried figure appear in the lower
left corner of the design; the figure may represent a flower spirit. The spirit
faces left in profile with his or her head turned slightly up. The figure has
long hair; the fingers of both hands are spread. The spirit's arms are raised at 135 degress and extend to the left;
the figure reaches and looks toward the gowned female to the left. The buried spirit may
touch or hold the gowned figure's left hand.

A nude female spirit lies on her side in the lower right corner of
the design; only her upper body is visible and she may be partially buried in
the earth. Her right arm is bent with her hand on her breast and her fingers
spread. Her hair is long and falls to the right. Her mouth may be open and her
eyes are cast down. She may be the mother of the two infants below. She may be offering the nipple of her right breast to feed the infant on the left. The infant
futhest left is seen from behind and faces up; his or her left arm is raised
vertically and reaches toward the female spirit. The infant to the right faces
left in profile and suckles at the female's left breast.

Four gowned female spirits sit or kneel above and to the left of
Milton. The figure furthest right kneels in a contracted position bent to the
right with her head down and her right arm bent around her head. The figure to
the left faces slightly right with her arms raised vertically and her palms
turned up. The spirit to the left faces left with her head bent back; her arms are
raised vertically with the palms turned up. The spirit to the left faces left
with her head bent back; her arms are slightly bent and raised vertically with
the palms held vertically. A fifth indistinct figure may appear to the
left.

Three gowned female spirits kneel on a cloud above and to the right
of Milton. The figure furthest right is seen from behind with her arms raised
at 135 degrees; her left palm is not visible, and her right palm is turned up.
The figure to the left faces forward with her head bent back; her arms are
raised at 135 degrees with the palms turned up. The spirit furthest left faces
left with her head down; the figure's left arm is bent upward.

Five constellations appear in the night sky. From left to right they
represent Cancer, Gemini, Orion, Taurus, and Aries. Perhaps eighteen stars in
all are visible.

The constellation furthest left represents Cancer. A nude figure
with short hair sits on a crab's back; the figure's legs are bent and spread
apart. The figure is seen from behind. His or her left arm may be bent upward;
the right arm is not pictured. The crab faces forward with two claws extended
downward and at least three legs visible.

The constellation second from the left represents Gemini; the twins
Castor and Pollux hover with their legs extended slightly to the right. Both
figures are nude. The figure to the left faces forward with his right arm
raised at 135 degrees. The figure to the right is seen from behind and faces
away with his right arm raised horizontally; he may hold a shield. Each figure
holds his left arm at his side; they may touch or hold hands.

The constellation third from the left represents Orion. The figure
is apparently nude, but clearly wears a belt of three stars. He faces forward
with his head turned slightly to the right. He has short, curly hair and a
beard. Orion's left leg is bent and drawn up; his right leg is obscured. The
figure's arms are raised at 135 degrees. A cloth or other drapery appears over
his left arm and he holds a sword in his right hand.

The constellation fourth from the left represents Taurus; only the
head and front legs of the bull are pictured. The bull's legs are bent as if it
is running. The bull has two short horns and its eyes are pictured as
stars.

The constellation furthest right represents Aries; the ram sits or
lays facing right. A single curved horn is visible, and it may have a tail. The
body of the ram is partially obscured by a nude(?) shepherd wearing a hat. The
figure is seen from behind; his or her body faces left with the head turned to
the right. The figure's left leg is bent and drawn up; the right leg is
extended downward. The shepherd's left arm is bent and the figure holds a
shepherd's crook with his or her left hand. The figure's right arm is raised at
45 degrees and may touch or hold the ram.

WBlake invBlake's signature appears in
the lower left corner. The bottoms of some of the letters, particularly the
final "v," have been trimmed off the paper.
